articles.description: Arsenal's winless run may normally be cause for concern - but the stats suggest they are still in control of the Premier League title race.

articles.description: Live NFL play-offs score updates, news and 5 Sports Extra commentary as the New England Partiots travel to the Denver Broncos in the NFL play-offs Conference Championship game.

articles.description: Liverpool left-back Andy Robertson looks set to remain at Anfield after the Reds decide they are currently unable to proceed with a deal to sell him to Tottenham.
articles.title: Liverpool: Andy Robertson unlikely to join Tottenham during January transfer window

articles.description: Aston Villa produce 'extraordinary' performance as they claim their first win at Newcastle since the infamous 2005 encounter
articles.title: 'Extraordinary' Villa claim first win at Newcastle since infamous 2005 trip

articles.description: Depleted Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts passed the latest test of their mettle in compelling draw with Celtic, writes Tom English.
articles.title: 'Intoxicating title fight impossible to call as Hearts refuse to buckle'

articles.description: Liam Rosenior has started well at Chelsea and it bodes well for the future amid ambitions to qualify for the Champions League.
articles.title: Liam Rosenior: Chelsea manager continues positive start

articles.description: Novak Djokovic moves through to the Australian Open quarter-finals as fourth-round opponent Jakub Mensik pulls out with an abdominal injury.

articles.description: Hearts and Celtic play out a thrilling draw in the Scottish Premiership title race. But did Hearts deserve to win? Or did a controversial red card cost Celtic?
articles.title: Hearts 'rattle' Celtic - but did red card play 'massive part' in draw?

articles.description: Manchester City capitalised on Chelsea's defeat to open up a nine-point lead at the top of the Women's Super League. Is the title race over?

articles.description: Newcastle United have yet to win a league game without Bruno Guimaraes since he made his debut for the club in 2022.
articles.title: Bruno Guimaraes: Why can't Newcastle win without Brazilian?
